alert.note: Alert for Upper Koyukuk Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 28 at 3:20PM AKST until March 01 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility occuring. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Visibility one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Over Dalton Highway Summits of the Upper Koyukuk Valley. * WHEN...From 3 PM this afternoon to 6 AM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult at times. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Large snow drifts will form. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds and lowest visibility in blowing snow will be over Dalton Highway Summits such as Finger Mountain. The heaviest snow will be from Hughes south.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
